datafield.subfield: Investigation of Contact Parameters of DEM Model in Flow Process

In the flow and accumulation process of granular materials, the appropriate choice of contact parameters has an important influence on the accuracy and precision of the simulation results. A series of experiments and simulations such as high rebound test, friction and wear test, stacking angle test, and rolling angle test were designed to measure the contact model parameters of the coefficient of restitution, static friction and rolling friction. The feasibility of the measuring methods and accuracy of the parameters were verified by comparing the experimental results with the simulation results of rectangular box flow test and rotating drum flow test. Finally, “N + 1” experimental verification method was proposed in this paper. These measurement methods are applicable to obtain contact parameters of Discrete Element Method (DEM) model for spherical particles.
